titles.title: Quality Assurance in the Private Sector Drug Testing Act of 1993
A bill to amend the Public Health Service Act to establish Federal standards to ensure quality assurance in private sector drug testing programs, and for other purposes.

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Labor and Human Resources.

term.name: Treatment and rehabilitation of narcotic addicts

bill.summary: 7/28/1993--Introduced. Quality Assurance in the Private Sector Drug Testing Act of 1993 - Amends the Public Health Service Act to prohibit a laboratory from performing a drug test in connection with any drug testing program subject to this Act unless the laboratory is certified under this Act. Directs the Secretary of Health and Human Services to establish standards for certifying laboratories. Requires an employer, as a condition of implementing or maintaining a drug testing program, to establish a written anti-drug abuse policy containing specified elements and a drug-free awareness program. Sets forth employee protections. Allows professional athletes to be treated as other employees under this Act except for certain provisions relating to confidentiality.
